articles.description: Andre Onana and Harry Maguire overcome recent criticism to help Manchester United secure their first Champions League win of the season against Copenhagen.
articles.title: Unlikely heroes Maguire and Onana step up for Man Utd

articles.description: Gabriel Jesus scores and grabs an assist to help Arsenal get back to winning ways in the Champions League with victory at Sevilla.
articles.title: Jesus helps Arsenal win at Sevilla

articles.description: BBC chief football writer Phil McNulty explains how Everton was one of the great loves of theatre impresario Bill Kenwright's life.
articles.title: 'Sporting love story with unhappy ending' - Kenwright and Everton

articles.description: Andre Onana saves a penalty in added time to give Manchester United a priceless Champions League victory against Copenhagen.
articles.title: Onana's added-time penalty save gives Man Utd win

articles.description: On an emotional night at Old Trafford, Manchester United pay tribute to club legend Sir Bobby Charlton in their first home game since his passing.
articles.title: Emotional scenes as Man Utd pay tribute to Sir Bobby Charlton

articles.description: Quinton de Kock hits a stunning 174 as South Africa thrash Bangladesh on the back of another blistering batting display in Mumbai.
articles.title: South Africa thrash Bangladesh as De Kock hits 174

articles.description: World Rugby announces a new competition starting in 2026 as part of a "significant overhaul" of the men's international calendar.
articles.title: World Rugby announces new competition in 'overhaul'

articles.description: Watch the highlights as South Africa trounce Bangladesh by 149 runs at the Cricket World Cup in Mumbai.
articles.title: De Kock stars as South Africa thrash Bangladesh

articles.description: Jude Bellingham continues his brilliant start to the season with another goal to help Real Madrid to a narrow Champions League win over Braga.
articles.title: Bellingham scores again as Real Madrid win at Braga

articles.description: Test captain Ben Stokes remains committed to England long-term despite turning down a three-year contract, says managing director Rob Key.
articles.title: Stokes committed despite taking one-year deal - Key
